            <td valign="bottom" width="7%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">50</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="49%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Director</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Didier
Choix.</font>&#160;&#160;Director since 2006.&#160;&#160;Member and President of
DDA &amp; Company, LLC, a corporate finance advisory boutique with offices in
New York, New York, and Paris, France, Mr. Choix has been advising small and
mid-cap companies contemplating acquisitions or divestitures, mainly in a
cross-border environment:&#160;&#160;1997 to present.&#160;&#160;In addition,
from 2002 to 2004, Mr. Choix was President of the Executive Board (&#8220;Directoire&#8221;)
of Basaltes SA (Paris, France), the largest French independent producer of
aggregates.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Robert E.
Edwards.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Director since 1998. Executive Vice
President of Fairchild Fasteners: March 1998 to January 2001. Chief Operating
Officer of Fairchild Fasteners U.S. Operations: January 2000 to January 2001.
Chief Executive Officer of Fairchild Fasteners Direct: March 1998 to December
1999. President and Chief Executive Officer of Edwards and Lock Management
Corporation (predecessor of Fairchild Fasteners Direct): 1983 to 1998. Pursuant
to the merger agreement by which the Company acquired Fairchild Fasteners
Direct, Mr.&#160;Edwards is to be nominated for election as a director every
year as long as he continues to own at least 541,258 shares of Class&#160;A
common stock.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Andrea
Goren</font>.&#160;&#160;Director since 2008.&#160;&#160;Mr.&#160;Goren is a
Managing Director of SG Phoenix LLC, a private equity firm, has served in that
capacity since May&#160;2003, and has been associated with Phoenix Enterprises
LLC since January&#160;2003. Prior to that, Mr.&#160;Goren served as Vice
President of Shamrock International,&#160;Ltd., a private equity firm, from
June&#160;1999 to December&#160;2002. Mr.&#160;Goren has been a member of the
Board of Directors of Xplore Technologies Corp. since
December&#160;2004.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Daniel
Lebard.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Director since 1996. Chairman of
Supervisory Board of Daniel Lebard Management Development SA, a consulting firm
in Paris, France, which performs management services: 1982 to Present. Chief
Executive Officer of ISPG and Executive Chairman of Albright&#160;&amp; Wilson
plc (manufacturer of added value phosphate products): 1999.&#160;&#160;Member of
Board and Audit Committee of Compagnie Lebon, Paris, France, a public investment
company with interests in real estate and hotels:&#160;&#160;2007 to
present.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Glenn
Myles.</font>&#160;&#160;Director since 2006.&#160;&#160;President and CEO of
First Wall Street Capital International, an investment banking firm: November
1999 to present.&#160;&#160;In connection with these positions, Mr. Myles has
held various ownership positions in diverse businesses such as retail, auto
parts, finance, shopping centers, hotels, oil drilling, music businesses and
movie production companies.&#160;&#160;Mr. Myles also served as Senior
Vice-President of the Davis Companies, the holding company of Marvin
Davis:&#160;&#160;1995-2000.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Philip
S. Sassower</font>.&#160;&#160;Director since 2008.&#160;&#160;Mr.&#160;Sassower
has served as the Chief Executive Officer of Xplore Technologies Corp. since
February&#160;2006, and has been Chairman of the Board of Xplore since
December&#160;2004.&#160;&#160;Mr.&#160;Sassower is also the Chief Executive
Officer of SG Phoenix LLC, a private equity firm, and has served in that
capacity since May&#160;2003. Mr.&#160;Sassower has also been Chief Executive
Officer of Phoenix Enterprises LLC, a private equity firm, and has served in
that capacity since 1996. Mr.&#160;Sassower served as Chairman of the Board of
Communication Intelligence Corp., an electronic signature solution provider,
from 1998 to 2002 and Chairman of the Board of Newpark Resources,&#160;Inc., an
environmental services company, from 1987 to 1996.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">78</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Dr.&#160;Eric&#160;I.
Steiner.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Director since 1988. President of the
Company: September 1998 to Present. Chief Operating Officer of the Company:
November 1996 to Present. Executive Vice President of the Company: November 1996
to September 1998. Senior Vice President, Operations of the Company: May 1992 to
November 1996. Dr. Steiner is a Director of Aqua Bounty Technologies, Inc.
(ABTX), a U.S. company traded on the AIM exchange in the United
Kingdom.&#160;&#160;The Company has an investment in Aqua Bounty.&#160;&#160;Dr.
Steiner is the son of Jeffrey J. Steiner.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Jeffrey J.
Steiner.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Director since 1985. Chairman of the
Board and Chief Executive Officer of the Company: December 1985 to Present.
President of the Company: July 1991 to September 1998. Director of Global
Sources Ltd.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Michael J.
Vantusko.</font>&#160;&#160;Director since 2006.&#160;&#160;President of
Grantwood Consulting, LLC, a financial advisory and consulting
firm:&#160;&#160;February 2000 to present.&#160;&#160;Chief Financial Officer
and Senior Vice President of Waterlink, Inc. (NYSE: WLK), an international
equipment consolidator:&#160;&#160;1996 to 2000.&#160;&#160;Chief Financial
Officer for Waxman Industries, Inc. (NYSE: WAX), a products
distributor:&#160;&#160;1995 to 1996.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Legal Proceedings
Involving Jeffrey Steiner:</font>&#160;&#160;Over the past several years, we
have disclosed certain legal proceedings in France involving Mr.&#160;J.
Steiner, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Company. This matter is
closed and all of the charges against Mr.&#160;J. Steiner, which resulted from
these proceedings, were dismissed except for one, relating to the unjustified
use in 1990 of corporate funds of Elf-Acquitaine, a French oil company.
Mr.&#160;J. Steiner was given a suspended sentence and ordered to pay a fine of
&#8364;500,000 by the French Court. This decision has resulted in no penal record in
France. The Company and Mr.&#160;J. Steiner&#8217;s respective rights and obligations
with respect to each other as a result of his defense in these proceedings were
resolved in connection with the Derivative Settlement referred to
below.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Derivative
Shareholder Actions:</font>&#160;&#160;Two actions, styled <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Noto v. Steiner, et al</font>., and
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Barbonel v. Steiner, et
al</font>., were commenced on November&#160;18, 2004, and November&#160;23,
2004, respectively, in the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware in and for
Newcastle County, Delaware. The plaintiffs alleged that each is or was a
shareholder of The Fairchild Corporation and purported to bring actions
derivatively on behalf of the Company, claiming, among other things, that
Fairchild executive officers received excessive pay and perquisites, and that
the Company&#8217;s directors approved such excessive pay and perquisites in violation
of their fiduciary duties to the Company. The complaints named as defendants all
of the Company&#8217;s directors, its Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, its
President and Chief Operating Officer, its then Chief Financial Officer, and its
General Counsel. On October&#160;24, 2005, a copy of a &#8220;Notice of Hearing and
Proposed Supplemental Settlement of The Fairchild Corporation Stockholder
Derivative Litigation&#8221; (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Derivative
Settlement</font>&#8221;) was mailed to all shareholders and was filed with the SEC on
a Form 8-K report. On November&#160;23, 2005, the Court of Chancery approved the
Derivative Settlement, which approval became final on December&#160;23, 2005.
The Derivative Settlement is further discussed below under &#8220;Certain
Transactions&#8221; and under &#8220;Corporate Governance Matters.&#8221;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Class Action
Litigation:</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#160;</font> In early August 2006,
three lawsuits were filed in the Delaware Court of Chancery, purportedly on
behalf of the public stockholders of the Company, regarding a going private
proposal by FA Holdings I, LLC, a limited liability company led by Jeffrey
Steiner and Philip Sassower, Chairman of The Phoenix Group LLC.&#160;&#160;The
defendants named in these actions included Jeffrey Steiner, Eric Steiner, Robert
Edwards, Daniel Lebard, Michael Vantusko, Didier Choix, Glenn Myles, FA Holdings
I, LLC and the Company.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#160;</font> The
allegations in each of the complaints, which were substantially similar,
asserted that the individual defendants had breached their fiduciary duties to
the Company&#8217;s stockholders and that the FA Holdings offer of $2.73 for each
share of the Company&#8217;s stock was inadequate and unfair.&#160;&#160;The suits
sought injunctive relief, rescission of any transaction, damages, costs and
attorneys&#8217; fees.&#160; On September 21, 2006, the Company announced that FA
Holdings I, LLC had withdrawn its proposal, and on December 5, 2006, that
discussions with FA Holdings regarding a potential transaction had been
terminated.&#160;&#160;On March 2, 2007, plaintiffs filed a stipulation with the
Delaware Court of Chancery seeking to dismiss the consolidated action, and on
March 6, 2007, the Delaware Court of Chancery so ordered.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Director
Independence:</font>&#160;&#160;Except for Eric Steiner and Jeffrey Steiner, all
director nominees are &#8220;independent&#8221; as defined in the listing standards of the
New York Stock Exchange, applicable Securities and Exchange Commission Rules,
and the Company&#8217;s Corporate Governance Guidelines.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">79</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Two New
Independent Directors </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Elected:&#160;
</font>Pursuant to the Derivative Settlement, the Board of Directors of the
Company&#160;&#160;elected two new independent directors as soon as
practicable.&#160;&#160;&#160; Pursuant to the Derivative Settlement, Jeffrey
Steiner and Eric Steiner (on behalf of themselves and their affiliates) agreed
that they would not take actions as stockholders to remove any such independent
directors prior to the Company&#8217;s 2007 annual meeting of stockholders.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;&#160; </font>In addition, the
Board elected a third independent director to replace an outgoing
director.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Two Additional
Independent Directors Elected in 2008:</font>&#160;&#160;In January, 2008, the
Board elected two further independent directors, Andrea Goren and Philip S.
Sassower.&#160;&#160;Their biographies are listed among the other directors
above, all in alphabetical order.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">COMMITTEES
OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>The Board has five standing committees
and a sixth standing committee which did not act during fiscal years 2006 or
2007; the Board also has had one special committee to evaluate the &#8220;going
private&#8221; negotiations, which disbanded effective December 12, 2006, and a second
special committee which developed the response to a tender offer for shares of
the Company&#8217;s Class A Common Stock. The following chart describes the function
and membership of each standing committee and the special committee and the
number of times each met during the 2006 and 2007 fiscal years:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Audit
Committee</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(FY
2006 &#8211; held 6 meetings;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">FY
2007&#8212;held 6 meetings and acted once by written consent)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Function</font></div>

            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="4%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="25%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Members</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td valign="middle" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="middle" width="60%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;

          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="1%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#61623;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="60%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Responsible
      for the appointment, compensation and oversight of the Company&#8217;s outside
      auditors and resolution of disagreements, if any, between outside auditors
      and management.</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" rowspan="5" valign="top" width="4%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td align="left" rowspan="5" valign="top" width="25%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Michael
      J. Vantusko (Chairman) (appointed 7/19/2006)</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Didier
      Choix (appointed 7/19/2006)</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Robert
      E. Edwards (appointed 3/8/2006)</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Daniel
      Lebard (appointed 3/8/2006)</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Steven
      L. Gerard resigned from the Board on 7/13/2006.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="1%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#61623;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="60%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Receives
      and responds to complaints (which may be submitted confidentially or
      anonymously) regarding accounting, internal account control or auditing
      matters.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="1%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#61623;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="60%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Examines
      and considers (and, where appropriate, pre-approves) matters relating to
      the internal and external audits of the Company&#8217;s accounts and its
      financial affairs.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="1%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#61623;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="60%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Selects
      the Company&#8217;s independent auditors.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="1%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#61623;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="60%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Reviews
      the Company&#8217;s auditing, financial reporting and internal control
      functions.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Audit
Committee has been established in accordance with Section&#160;10A(m) of the
Exchange Act which (among other things) requires companies to establish a
committee of board members for the purpose of overseeing the accounting and
financial reporting processes of the company and audits of the financial
statements of the company.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-STYLE: italic">Financial
Expert:</font>&#160;&#160;The Board of Directors has determined that Michael J.
Vantusko, a member of the Audit Committee, is a &#8220;financial expert&#8221; as defined in
Securities and Exchange Commission Rules. Such determination was based, in part,
on the following qualifications:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">He

      private equity investing firm.</font></div>
            </td>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">INFORMATION
AS TO EXECUTIVE OFFICERS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Set forth
below is certain information about each current executive officer of the Company
who is not a director of the Company. Related party transactions between the
Company and certain officers (or their immediate family members or affiliates)
are set forth in this proxy statement under the heading <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#8220;Certain
Transactions</font>.&#8221;&#160;&#160;&#160;Ages are stated as of December 31,
2007.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Klaus Esser</font>, 55, has served as
the Managing Director of PoloExpress since 1980. Fairchild acquired PoloExpress
in </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">November
2003.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Michael L. McDonald,</font> 43, has
served as Chief Financial Officer of the Company since August 2006, as Senior
Vice President since October 2006, as Vice President of the Company from May
2002 until October 2006, and as Controller of the Company from July 2000 to
August 2006. He served as Assistant Controller from 1997 to July 2000.
Mr.&#160;McDonald has been employed by the Company since 1989.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Donald E. Miller,</font> 60, has
served as Executive Vice President of the Company since September 1998, as
General Counsel since January 1991 and as Corporate Secretary since January
1995. He served as Senior Vice President of the Company from January 1991
through September 1998.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Richard P. Nyren, </font>37, has
served as Controller of the Company since September 2007 and from October 2006
through August 2007, as Assistant Controller of the Company.&#160;&#160;Between
2005 and 2006, he was Assistant Controller at Cybertrust Incorporated and from
2004 to 2005, a Senior Analyst at the Center for Financial Research &amp;
Analysis.&#160;&#160;From 2002 to 2004, he attended the University of
Maryland-College Park, where he earned a master&#8217;s degree in business
administration.&#160;&#160;Mr. Nyren is a Certified Public
Accountant.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Warren D. Persavich,</font> 54, has
served as President of the Company&#8217;s Aerospace Division since April 1999, and as
Senior Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of Banner Aerospace, Inc. from
May 1998 through September 2006. Prior to that, he served as Senior Vice
President and Chief Financial Officer of Banner Aerospace from June 1990 through
May 1998, and as Vice President of Banner Aerospace from March 1990 through June
1990.</font></div>

    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">SECTION
16(A) BENEFICIAL OWNERSHIP REPORTING COMPLIANCE</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Section&#160;16(a)
of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 requires the Company&#8217;s directors and
officers to file reports (on Forms 3, 4 and 5) with the Securities and Exchange
Commission, disclosing their ownership, and changes in their ownership, of stock
in the Company. Copies of these reports must also be furnished to the Company.
Based solely on a review of these copies, the Company believes that during the
2006 and the 2007 fiscal years all such reports were filed on a timely
basis.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">BUSINESS
CONDUCT POLICIES AND CODE OF ETHICS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Board
of Directors has adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applicable to all
employees, officers and directors of the Company. The code is posted on the
Company&#8217;s website (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">www.fairchild.com</font>). You may
also request a copy from the Company&#8217;s Corporate Secretary.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The Board
has also adopted a Code of Ethics for Senior Financial Officers (including the
Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Financial Officer, the Principal Accounting
Officer or Controller, and all persons performing similar functions on behalf of
the Company). The code is posted on the Company&#8217;s website (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">www.fairchild.com</font>). You may
also request a copy from the Company&#8217;s Corporate Secretary. The officers subject
to this code were surveyed for fiscal years 2006 and 2007and will be surveyed
annually for compliance. Only the Board of Directors can amend or grant waivers
from the provisions of the code, and any such amendments or waivers will be
promptly posted on the Company&#8217;s website.</font></div>

11</a>.&#160;&#160;EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">DIRECTORS&#8217;

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Board
members who are not salaried employees of the Company receive separate
compensation for Board service. That compensation was as follows in the most
recent fiscal year:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>

          <tr>
            <td colspan="5" valign="bottom" width="76%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Fiscal

            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="24%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline">Name</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Fees

      ($)</font></font></div>

      Awards <font style="DISPLAY: inline">($)(1)</font></font></div>

          <tr>
            <td valign="bottom" width="24%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Under
      the 1996 Non-Employee Directors Stock Option Plan (the &#8220;1996 NED Plan&#8221;)
      each non-employee director was issued stock options for 30,000 shares at
      the time he or she was first elected as a director. Thereafter, each
      director was issued stock options for 1,000 shares on an annual basis
      (immediately after each Annual Meeting). The 1996 NED Plan expired in
      September 2006 and there is no current proposal to adopt a new stock
      option plan in its place.&#160;&#160;Outstanding options continue in full
      force and effect.</font></div>

      </font></td>
            <td align="left" valign="middle" width="61%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$10,000
      a year.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">REPORT
OF THE COMPENSATION AND STOCK OPTION COMMITTEE</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following report does not constitute solicitation material and is not considered
filed or incorporated by reference into any other Company filing under the
Securities Act of 1933 or the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, unless we state
otherwise.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Compensation and Stock Option Committee is composed of at least three
independent Directors. It has initial responsibility for all compensation
actions affecting the Company&#8217;s executive officers, including base salaries,
bonus awards, stock option awards and the terms and conditions of their
employment.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Compensation Discussion and Analysis is set forth beginning on the next
page.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion
and Analysis required by 17 CFR Section 229.402(b) of Securities Regulation
S-K.&#160;&#160;Based upon this review and these discussions, the Committee has
recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and
Analysis set forth in this report should be included in the proxy
statement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;Respectfully
submitted by the members of the Compensation and Stock Option Committee of the
Board of Directors, as of January 10, 2008:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 252pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Daniel
Lebard, Chairman</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 216pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Michael
J. Vantusko</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 252pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Robert E.
Edwards</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">84</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND
ANALYSIS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><br>&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Compensation
Objectives; What the Compensation Program Is Designed to Reward</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Compensation Committee&#8217;s goals are to:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 45pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Provide
      compensation competitive with other companies facing similar
      challenges.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 45pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Encourage
      executives to increase profitability and shareholder
  value.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 45pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Promote
      the success of business units of the
Company.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 45pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Directly
      relate compensation to Company performance and/or the objective value of
      individual service.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Elements
of Executive Officer Compensation:&#160;&#160;Base Salary and Annual Incentive
Bonus</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash
compensation consists of two components: (i)&#160;a base salary that is at least
competitive with that paid by companies facing similar challenges, and
(ii)&#160;an annual incentive opportunity that is variable and is reflective of
the financial performance of the Company and/or the individual performance of
the executive officer. When high levels of performance are achieved, the level
of cash compensation may well exceed the median of the market. Conversely, when
the Company, business unit, or the individual falls short of realizable goals,
the level of cash compensation may be below the market median.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
objective of this mix is to deliver total annual cash compensation competitive
with compensation offered at other companies facing similar challenges for
similar positions.&#160;&#160;In fiscal 2007 and 2006, no non-cash compensation
was awarded to executive officers.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Why
the Company Chooses to Pay Each Element:&#160;&#160;Mix Between Salary and
Annual Incentive Pay</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The mix
between salary and annual incentive pay is related to an executive&#8217;s job grade.
Executives at higher grade levels in the Company may have a greater percentage
of their total cash compensation contingent on the accomplishment of assigned
business objectives, i.e. the higher the executive grade level, the greater the
proportion of annual compensation that may be &#8220;at risk.&#8221;&#160;&#160;&#160;The
Settlement Agreement has resulted in the compensation for Mr. J. Steiner and Mr.
E. Steiner being fixed, however, pending renegotiation with the Compensation
Committee.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The award
and size of the performance bonus are based upon: (i)&#160;the executive
officer&#8217;s performance against goals determined by the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive
Officer; and/or (ii)&#160;the performance of the executive officer&#8217;s unit within
the Company against that unit&#8217;s goals; or (iii)&#160;the performance of the
Company against Company goals. Goals vary from year to year and from unit to
unit and, with regard to individual goals of executive officers, usually include
both quantitative and qualitative factors.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Compensation Committee engaged Hewitt Associates LLC to serve as an independent
consultant to review the compensation of the Company&#8217;s senior executives and,
where appropriate, recommend to the Compensation Committee changes to such
senior executives&#8217; compensation based on comparable arrangements for similarly
situated senior executives in comparable companies in similar circumstances and
facing comparable challenges.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">How
the Company Determines the Amounts of Each Element to Pay</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company manages the total cash compensation to provide median levels of cash
compensation at average levels of corporate, business unit, or individual
performance.&#160;&#160;The Compensation Committee considers the past
compensation of each executive officer in determining the amount of each element
of future pay.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">For two
named executive officers, Messrs. Esser and Persavich, contractual provisions
govern their compensation, as described below under the heading &#8220;Employment
Agreements and Change of Control Arrangements&#8221;.&#160;&#160;For Messrs. J.
Steiner and E. Steiner, the Settlement Agreement limits their compensation.
There is no set formula or written contract for determining the amounts of
payments to Mr. McDonald or Mr.&#160;&#160;Miller.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">85</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">How
the Company Decides How Each Compensation Element Fits into the Overall
Compensation Objectives and Affects Decisions Regarding Other
Elements</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
higher proportion of contingent cash compensation, in the form of bonuses, for
higher job-grade executives, is consistent with the Company&#8217;s desire to reward
excellence, maintain compensation at competitive levels in relation to other
companies, and ultimately to increase shareholder value.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Long-term and Short-term
Compensation</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#160;</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>The Committee is currently keeping the
formula for the Retirement Plan unchanged.&#160;&#160;All benefits under the
Supplementary Executive Retirement Plan (SERP) have been frozen and there is no
plan to adopt another SERP.&#160;&#160;No proposals regarding long-term
compensation are currently under consideration.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash
and Non-cash Compensation</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>Compensation decisions are currently
made solely with regard to short-term cash compensation.&#160;&#160;No stock
options were granted to executive officers during the fiscal 2007 or
2006.&#160;&#160;Bonuses and other cash and non-cash compensation are determined
based on a combination of job-grade, where a higher job grade makes more income
at risk, and individual performance, which is measured in terms of success of an
executive officer within assigned areas of responsibility, and employment
contracts.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Timing of Compensation
Awards</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>Awards of compensation are currently
made after the end of each fiscal year, and upon promotions of
officers.&#160;&#160;Since all of the compensation is currently made in cash,
there is no issue as to the timing of non-cash compensation.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Specific
Items of Corporate Performance Taken Into Account in Setting Compensation
Policies and Making Compensation Decisions</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>Operating revenues, EBITDA, enterprise
value, and profitability of divisions and/or subsidiaries are the primary
measure of executive officer performance in terms of meeting specific items of
corporate performance.&#160;&#160;An example of corporate performance taken into
account in setting compensation is that of the Aerospace Division&#8217;s
profitability, leading to additional compensation for Mr. Persavich, and of the
performance of the PoloExpress business, leading to additional compensation and
a re-negotiated contract for Mr. Esser, as described below under the heading
&#8220;Employment Agreements and Change of Control
Arrangements&#8221;.&#160;&#160;&#160;Except for the compensation for Mr. Esser and
Mr. Persavich, all awards based on operating performance were based on
discretion of the Compensation Committee, rather than on any
formula.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Individual
Performance and/or Contributions to These Items of the Company&#8217;s Performance
Taken Into Account for Company Profitability</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>Individual contributions to
profitability often take the form of specialized services that are highly
compensated in the outside market for professional services.&#160;&#160;An
example of specialized services value is the fiscal 2006 bonus for Mr. Miller,
Executive Vice President, Secretary, and General Counsel, who led the legal
teams which developed, cleared, and closed the sale of the Airport Plaza
shopping center in Long Island, New York in fiscal 2006.&#160;&#160;When
acquisitions or divestitures of businesses are completed, those participating in
the transactions may receive bonus payments due to the high value accorded to
managerial and merger and acquisition experience.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Factors
Considered in Decisions to Increase or Decrease Compensation
Materially</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>The measures described in the two
paragraphs immediately above, on corporate performance and individual
contributions, are the primary factors on which compensation decisions are
based.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">86</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Role
of Executive Officers in Determining Executive Compensation</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>The Compensation Committee from time to
time invites various executive officers of the Company and/or its subsidiaries
to meetings of the Committee to gather information about proposals for
compensation and takes into account recommendations from the CEO and Chairman of
the Board, Mr. J. Steiner, who is not a member of the Committee.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Total
Compensation Program</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>The Committee believes that the total
compensation program for executives of the Company (cash compensation and
bonuses) is on a level with the compensation programs provided by other
companies facing similar challenges. The Committee believes that any amounts
paid under the annual incentive plan will be appropriately related to corporate
and individual performance.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>The Committee approved salary and
annual incentive pay for the Company&#8217;s named executive officers, as set forth
under the Summary Compensation Table of this Proxy Statement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Compensation
of CEO</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>Mr. J. Steiner has served as Chairman
of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of the Company since 1985, and as
President from July 1991 through September 1998. In fixing Mr.&#160;J. Steiner&#8217;s
salary and target bonus levels, the Committee and the Board typically review the
strategic direction and financial performance of the Company, including
enterprise value, revenue, and profit levels.&#160;&#160;In addition, the
Committee reviews Mr.&#160;J. Steiner&#8217;s performance as Chairman of the Board and
Chief Executive Officer, his importance to the Company and his success in
implementing its strategic goals, both through his entrepreneurial actions and
his investment banking acumen.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Base Compensation</font>&#8212;Mr. J.
Steiner&#8217;s aggregate base compensation for fiscal 2006 was at the rate of
$2,500,000 per year for the first three months and eleven days of the fiscal
year, consisting of (i)&#160;$1,700,000 pursuant to his employment agreement
with the Company, (ii)&#160;$400,000 per year pursuant to his employment
agreement with Banner Aerospace, plus (iii)&#160;$400,000 for services in
Switzerland with respect to the Company&#8217;s European operations. Pursuant to the
Derivative Settlement, this compensation was reduced to $1,325,000 per year,
effective as of January&#160;12, 2006. Such reduction in compensation will
remain in place until such time as the Compensation Committee and Mr.&#160;J.
Steiner agree on the terms of a new or amended employment
agreement.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Stock Option Grants</font>&#8212;No stock
options were granted to Mr.&#160;J. Steiner during fiscal 2007 or
2006.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Incentive Compensation for fiscal
2007 and 2006</font>&#8212;The Committee determined that Mr.&#160;J. Steiner should
receive no incentive compensation for fiscal 2007 or 2006.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Mr.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">&#160;</font>Esser and Mr.

            <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">(2)</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Includes
      for Mr. E. Steiner $11,154 which was earned in fiscal 2005, but payment of
      which has been deferred.&#160;&#160;The aggregate amounts of perquisites
      included in the Summary Compensation Table under the heading &#8220;All Other
      Compensation&#8221;&#160;for fiscal 2007 consist of:&#160;&#160;401(k) match;
      financial services; personal W-2 auto; and life and disability
      insurance.&#160;&#160;Personal W-2 auto for Mr. E. Steiner was $27,966 in
      fiscal 2007, based on one vehicle in Germany for part of fiscal 2007 and
      one in the United States for part of fiscal 2007. The Euro amount for the
      German auto was converted to US Dollars based on the monthly average
      interbank rates posted on the OANDA.com website.&#160;&#160;The
      incremental cost to the Company for all vehicles was calculated based on
      the miles driven for personal and for company
  use.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><br></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">EMPLOYMENT
AGREEMENTS AND CHANGE OF CONTROL ARRANGEMENTS</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 27pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following discussion of executive employment contracts summarizes employment
agreements and change of control agreements.&#160;&#160;These agreements are the
sources of the Plan-Based Awards to Messrs. Persavich and Esser as well as the
salary and bonus payments of all other named executive officers.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt"></font>There are no remaining awards of change
of control payments due under current contracts.&#160;&#160;All previously
earned change of control payments have been paid, except for $3,140,000 due to
Mr. J. Steiner upon termination of his employment with the
Company.&#160;&#160;Mr. E. Steiner has relinquished any future change of control
payments.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">89</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
